meanings.definition: To circle or go around again.
meanings.sent1: The children recircled the playground multiple times during recess.
meanings.sent2: The airplane recircled the airport before landing due to bad weather.
meanings.sent3: The cat recircled the same tree over and over, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts recircled back to the happy memories of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The river recircled the small island, creating a peaceful and serene atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To form a circle around something again.
meanings.sent1: The security guards recircled the building to ensure no one could enter.
meanings.sent2: The hikers recircled the campsite to set up a protective barrier against wild animals.
meanings.sent3: The bees recircled the hive, making sure all the honey was safely stored inside.
meanings.sent4: The dancers recircled the stage, showcasing their synchronized movements.
meanings.sent5: The fence recircled the garden, keeping the vegetables safe from hungry rabbits.
